website_summaries.verdict: An affordable model that is both attractive and practical.
pros: Features a unique foldaway  design for easy storage when not in use
cons: Our testers found that it doesn't drain very well, resulting in pooling water and slow-drying dishes

customer_reviews.title: Not sure why this gets such good reviews
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this a year ago I was thrilled and gave it 5 stars. But I'm coming back a year later and changing my review. I'm not rough on my kitchen equipment and this thing is breaking into pieces. One of the collapsible sides broke months ago and even though it's still on it's not sturdy anymore. The piece at the front that allows the water to drain came off this morning and won't go back on because it's plastic. The whole thing is made of plastic. I would not purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Billie

customer_reviews.title: I very rarely absolutely love any product
customer_reviews.text: I very rarely absolutely love any product. But this dish rack is awesome and worth every penny. I can pack this rack with so much stuff it's amazing. It is classy and modern looking too. Best buy ever and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioning after a few months
customer_reviews.text: One of the 2 long removable sides no longer snaps into place on my unit. I have to be sure nothing heavy leans on that side now, because dishes have caused it to fall all the way off, sending heavy items onto the floor. Not good for my baby, dog, or my feet!
customer_reviews.author: A. CUNNINGHAM

customer_reviews.title: Water drips through wrong hole
customer_reviews.text: The water leaks through the gap between grey flat and base drain. Finished with water on counter multiple times.
customer_reviews.author: An average reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great support
customer_reviews.text: OXO sent me a full replacement, and this one has lasted without breaking. I still have to be careful with the plate rack, so I would like to see OXO make it sturdier in a future version. Original review: It was awesome, but then the plate rack broke. Little bits of plastic went everywhere. The rest of the dishrack is great, but the plate rack is lower quality than the rest of it.
customer_reviews.author: TimTheEnchanter

customer_reviews.title: Looked great but a disappontment
customer_reviews.text: I have had this rack for 6 months. There is constantly water under it after washing dishes. The spout is not long enough to let the water go into the sink. Luckily I wash and dry my dishes pretty quick so I get the water off the counter quickly, but for those that don't beware it will ruin your countertop. The sides don't always lock in place which is annoying. The final straw was today when I opened the rack and the dish part that lifts off broke so now it will not be able to hold items securely. VERY disappointed. I would not recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda R. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Designed Water Drainage. I would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: It is very poorly designed in terms of water drainage: drain spout does not work unless you simply pour lots of water into the rack. Most of water from wet washed dishes evaporate instead of draining, leaving faint stains on the rack. Some reviwers say this is the best rack. I cannot agree with such reviews at all: I heard on NPR that some people are paid to give rave ratings on Amazon. Even cleaning is difficult. I would not buy it again. I should have return it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very bad design!!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible!!!! Whoever designed this obviously never washed a dish in their entire human life. My wife , who doesn't do dishes, wanted something "Stylish"--- I, the one who actually washes the dishes, wanted something more functional --that will hold more than 5-6 washed items. I WILL win in the end, I'm on strike until this thing is out of my kitchen and replaced with something that will hold an entire meal's worth of dishes.
customer_reviews.author: stephen P Bartley

customer_reviews.title: Gets dirty quickly, especially in areas with hard water (think ...
customer_reviews.text: Drain spout seems gimmicky and doesn't help get the water out of the rack. Gets dirty quickly, especially in areas with hard water (think Southern California). Smaller than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design-Drainboard spout has gap causing water to drip through all over counter
customer_reviews.text: At the beginning I really liked this type of drainboard. Then water started leaking through the spout that is suppose to drain the water into sink. Instead - water is dripping through a gap in the spout underneath the drainboard. I purchased the silcone matt for underneath it .Then I put a microfiber mat underneath the silcone mat - still didn't help. Finally I rigged a piece of plastic underneath the spout to cover the gap which is working sometimes. After going through this for 2 years - I'm done with this drainboard and will be looking to replace it with a better design
customer_reviews.author: Orianna

customer_reviews.title: BEST dishrack I've ever purchased!
customer_reviews.text: I read many reviews for dish racks before purchasing this one. Get THIS dish rack! It's awesome, stylish, versatile, and roomy. It has a slope and drains well. It doesn't take up too much space! No RUSTING! Ample space for silverware, and the sections have holes in the bottom for drainage!!! The slots for plates fold down in case you have lots of bowls so you can utilize space better! I LOVE it. :)
customer_reviews.author: Traeannah Brown

customer_reviews.title: Huge Fan of OXO BUT Not This Product
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something new and nicer than my old fashioned coated wire rack. I wanted to like this, and there are some nice features (like the fold down plate rack), but it is large, doesn't drain well, and is hard to clean. After trying it for a couple weeks, we can't really send it back, and am disappointed for the price. I will likely deal with it as long as I can, and then go back to the old style again. Oh well, it was worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: Shari_C

customer_reviews.title: The extended rear height legs put the rack on an angle when opening up the drain sprout for easy drainage. The folding mechanism
customer_reviews.text: OXO you thought of everything. The extended rear height legs put the rack on an angle when opening up the drain sprout for easy drainage. The folding mechanism for quick storage so to clear your counter off when entertaining. The ability to collapse the dish holder when placing larger items in the strain area. I love it if I could afford it I would by it for my 4 sisters, nieces and as housewarming gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Overall this does the job that I need it to ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall this does the job that I need it to do and I appreciate that the utensil holders are WAY easier to remove and clean than conventional dish racks. I don't fold it up to its compact form as often as I thought I would, and I'm still not totally over how much this cost, and I thought it was going to be much less bulky than it actually is. I'm also not too fond of how awkward the draining spout is. The edge of the tray is slightly higher than the spout so it will only drain if there's really a lot of water in the tray or if it's tipped over.
customer_reviews.author: M. Mana

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Drain Properly
customer_reviews.text: Great little dish rack for a small space. The only problem with it is that it does not drain properly. There is no slight pitch for the water to be pulled towards the draining hole, so the water simply stays in the dish rack unless you tilt it towards the hole.
customer_reviews.author: Hec09

customer_reviews.title: Biggest piece of crap I have ever purchased, might be counterfeit
customer_reviews.text: This is the first review I have ever written, because I have never been more disappointed in something. This thing is a huge piece of JUNK. The 4 legs do not even lay flat, I currently have 2 legs touching flat on the counter, one not touching at all, and the fourth kind of touching. The rack itself is the cheapest piece of plastic, it is bowed, does not even look flat. It looks like a frisbee that I bent with my hands, it is that cheap. Do Not buy, period. Might be useful as frisbee though actually.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto

customer_reviews.title: Terrible design more than a few small plates and cups
customer_reviews.text: I usually love the design and quality of all the OXO products so when we needed a new dish drying rack, I immediately got this one. I've been SO disappointed. The rack is so awkward, I can't fit anything except for small plates and silverware. It's terrible for cups, bowls, and knives larger than a paring knife And while there is a large open are for "large items," I have found that items don't actually dry well in that area. Yes, there are ridges at the bottom to allow air flow and water to drain, but it doesn't seem to be enough and I end up towel drying everything the next morning.
customer_reviews.author: Anne in MD

customer_reviews.title: Will you really be stashing this away when not in use?
customer_reviews.text: Bought it with plans of stashing it when not in use. Ends up we need a dish drainer more than we expected. So this stays on the counter all the time. And for this purpose, not a good option. The plastic gets moldy, the dish rack portion is a weird angle, the drain hole doesn't drain completely. If you need something that will be on your counter all the time, go stainless. I can see this being used in a RV, boat, or vacation home. If you're using it in an application where it cant dry thoroughly often, you'll be washing it a lot
customer_reviews.author: Jay Ho

customer_reviews.title: A great countertop dish drainer. Very flexible for different wash up jobs.
customer_reviews.text: We love this thing. It sets up easily. Does take some space but it holds a good amount of dish and silver ware. Glasses are held along both sides. Dishes go in a rack at the back, or the rack can be flattened or removed. There are three separate openings along either side of the rear portion for utensils, or they may be removed if you need the additional unobstruted space. Excess water can drain through a pluggable opening at the front. Only suggestion I have is that the rear could be set a little higher than the front to promote a natural flow of the water while the dishes are draining.
customer_reviews.author: MiniPilot

customer_reviews.title: Well thought out!
customer_reviews.text: Oxo products keep making their way into my house because they are built so well and often have clever attributes. This dish rack is no exception. It comes fully assembled, just open the box and you'll be drying dishes in 60 seconds. The way they built it makes you feel like it's extremely solid and will last for a long time which I hope it does. The drain to the sink makes it easy to put away without dealing with standing water. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Cosmo Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: I love this dish rack, it’s the best I’ve ever owned. It’s durable. It can hold a lot more than I expected. I like that you can take the plate rack off for extra drying space. I love that it can be folded up and put away to make counter space. It’s very easy to clean. We have treated water and mineral deposits used to be so hard to clean off my other racks. This wipes off easily. I like that it drains water out of the rack.
customer_reviews.author: gdtamess

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Designed Dish Drying Tray
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful new drying tray. I luv the design and the convenience it has for putting it away if needed. My only negative is the draining spout location. I have a tight sink area and having it on a long end side is just inconvenient. The only other spot that I would recommend for the closable spout is on the bottom center and allow the water to drain to the center. But I still think it is a great drying tray. The design is far better then the normal cookie cutter design that is used most.
customer_reviews.author: E. Leopold

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Dish Rack
customer_reviews.text: This dish rack is great. Bit expensive, but well built and great usage of space. This has made our island look little better (less clutter) and helps to contains the dripping water inside the rack which can be drained later. When not in use this can be folded and stored very easily. The only complaint I have is regarding the draining mechanism which could have been better. The slope provided is not sufficient to drain all the water.
customer_reviews.author: Vatsa

customer_reviews.title: Didnt disappoint
customer_reviews.text: The product seems very sturdy, I like the stainless steel. The water can pool a little, the gradient isn't that pronounced. I do like how easy it is to collapse so it doesn't take up space. I do think the clips that elevate the drying rack could clip into place more reliably, if you move it backwards they can start to collapse. Overall I enjoy this product, if you want one that you don't want to be constantly out taking up counter space this is for you. However, if you do not want or need to collapse your drying rack there may be other products more suitable to your needs.
customer_reviews.author: w017smf

customer_reviews.title: dish rack for everyone
customer_reviews.text: absolutely love this dish rack! i love the fact that the sides fold in and the legs are foldable so to make it either lay flat on the counter or angle it so the water drains from the rack. i also love the idea that the holders that hold the spoons and forks etc are detachable. make it easy to clean when you need to. the other great idea, the rack that holds the plates, its foldable so that it can lay flat inside to make room for a larger pot if you have no plates to dry. a great idea and totally worth the investment. feels durable and its easy to wash. i highly recommed this!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn M. Espinoza

customer_reviews.title: Fold Away Dish Rack
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had bought this a long time ago. I used to use a drying mat, but am so glad I bought this dish rack. It holds a whole lot more than my drying mat, and it helps to keep my dishes organized. It seems sturdy and excess water drains off of the rack into the sink helping to keep my dishes dry. Now I just use my drying mat under the tray to catch any excess drips. Shipping was fast too. 5 Stars!
customer_reviews.author: J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect for our small apartment
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for our small apartment. I was dreading living without a dishwasher for the first time in over 10 years, but this makes hand-washing pretty easy. It folds up and stores easily under our sink. Great for when you are on kitchen duty and don't have someone designated to dry for you. Easily holds 4 dinner plates, drinking glasses, silverware and small odds and ends. For larger cooking projects, you have to do 2 shifts. .one for cookware and 1 for dinnerware.. . but still great!
customer_reviews.author: hillsing

customer_reviews.title: A very impressive update of the traditional wire dish rack
customer_reviews.text: This a very well thought-out piece of equipment. I love the 6 (six!) utensil compartments which let me separate table ware from cooking tools and cooking tools from cleaning brushes. (Three more to go.) And the fact that the rack feature itself is collapsible makes the main chamber so versatile. Finally, though I have no room for storing this device when it's not in use, the fact that the entire device is collapsible saves me space in the kitchen whenever I need more room. Thanks so much for this excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Philo Yeager

customer_reviews.title: Great design dish rack.
customer_reviews.text: We love this. One minor complaint is the drain spout got knocked off one day by a guest washing dishes. It made its way into the disposal and tripped the breaker. No biggie to resolve but it got a little chewed up. Cleaned up edges with razor blade and reinstalled (pain) all good. We contacted OXO for a new part but no response YMMV. The design of the rack for holding things to drain is well thought out.
customer_reviews.author: Fraz

customer_reviews.title: Works great, cleans easy, no rust!
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what we needed for dishwasher overflow. It usually sits on the counter but I did store it under the sink once and it folded and unfolded great. I love having that option! For its small size it sure holds a lot. As others noted it doesn't drain all the way but I just tilt it after emptying it and rinse with faucet sprayer. The build-up washes away easily. Glad I took a chance, I love this drainer!
customer_reviews.author: joy

customer_reviews.title: I feel silly writing a review for a dish rack.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I've used it for 3 months now, and there is no wear at all. It's solidly built, well thought out, and folds up nicely to be put away. It holds more than I thought it would, including big cookie sheets that used to tip over my old rack. You can put it in the top rack of the dishwasher. OXO makes good stuff,
customer_reviews.author: Widebandid

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: It's okay. The drain thing falls off occasionally. It also isn't as durable as it looks in the photo. The sides with the silverware holders snap off, so if you load too much stuff in the rack the pressure will snap the side off and everything will go crashing down. I broke a bunch of stuff the first time I used it because it looks deceptively sturdy and I overloaded it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason McDowell

customer_reviews.title: I love OXO products and I really thought this was going ...
customer_reviews.text: This is not designed well AT ALL. I love OXO products and I really thought this was going to be great. However, out dished don't really fit in the slots, the cupholders are for super narrow glass, and all of the water pools on the bottom making super nasty. Yes, it has a drain, but you have to constantly tilt it- so nasty gunk gets built up. Having two places for silverware to dry is nice, but that is honestly it...
customer_reviews.author: C. C.

customer_reviews.title: OXO Good Grips Convertible Foldaway Dish Rack, Stainless Steel
customer_reviews.text: If you are washing a bit pile of dishes this rack isn't the right one to use - not enough storage capacity! Drainage is great though. I do like that it is compact and can be put away. I wish the interior would be designed with more storage capacity. The inner rack is sturdy but doesn't allow more dishes so you have to wash in batches.
customer_reviews.author: Teardrop

customer_reviews.title: Sucks
customer_reviews.text: Horrible drainage. The water sits everywhere and over time it will get nasty. It doesn’t drain out!!! You would think for a $35/40 item it will have a better design and purpose. Oh gosh NO. If you do real home family cooking..this dish rack will be too small for you and pot and pans will fall out as you pile them on top. Skip this one. Epic failure dish rack.
customer_reviews.author: Bubu

customer_reviews.title: A premium and a sanity saver
customer_reviews.text: While it is not the ideal dish rack because of space, the reason we bought it was because of space! I couldn't fit my old dish rack anywhere in the tiny kitchen of the house we moved into. As long as you don't wait more than 2 days between washings, this does work pretty well for our house of 4. It folds down really flat and we tuck it away on top of the microwave when it's not in use. Don't forget to wash it out every week.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla L

customer_reviews.title: Impractical Design
customer_reviews.text: Impractical/Unrealistic design for daily use. A fold away design was not why we purchased it, it appeared to be well designed from the photos and description, but when it arrived it was a bit flimsy due to the fold away sides, that once folded blocked the space inside the rack thus taking away from the actual drip dry area. This was sent back the same day, it looks kinda cool, but for daily use it is bulky when both sides are folded out, and restricted of even one side is folded in to save room or just attempt to fit next to or behind your sink area. Too bad b/c we had higher hopes for it
customer_reviews.author: The Sicilian

customer_reviews.title: Gave It A Chance...NOT the Right Fit for a Larger Kitchen/Family....!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased last Sept...after a year, it's time to move on....the design has flaws that just didn't work for our household. Water left spots and stains and never drained properly, even when raised high at one end, and the edge hanging over the counter edge to increase the angle....going to dishrack heaven...RIP...!!!
customer_reviews.author: OhPleaseBuyMeTHAT

customer_reviews.title: I love it!  Solved our problem of sink lip.
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite kitchen accessories. Works beautifully and very well-made. The drainspout is great - we have a large lip around our sink and had to prop up a conventional drain pan. this one has plenty of room, it drains well, does not retain water, looks great. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Twins

customer_reviews.title: GREAT RACK :-)
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this dish rack. After buying cheap dish racks for decades that rust and get gross, I decided to spend a little extra. As my dad used to say, "you get what you pay for". This is definitely worth the price, PLUS, it folds so it can be stored away!
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Poor drainage low sides
customer_reviews.text: This has very poor drainage because it is level, and the exit for the water is a good concept but it's leaky. I was disappointed with the purchase of this for the price. I ended up glueing props on one end so the water inside didn't stay stagnant. It's also not very deep, so I don't feel I get as many dishes into it as we need. It wasn't functional for my family of two. Looks cool but function is lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Gingerann

customer_reviews.title: Not as pretty as I'd like but it's very practical and durable.
customer_reviews.text: I've got 4 kids and a small sink. Dishes are always piling up and we're always cooking something. This holds large pots, pans, lots of cutlery -- it works great. Can't and shouldn't always stuff that stuff into the dishwasher! I like that it's foldable, if you wanted to take it camping you could easily clean and pack it -- just another versatile tidbit. Thick plastic, high quality. I wish it came in some other colors.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Our Dishwasher is on Permanent Vacation
customer_reviews.text: This is the best dish rack we've ever used! Start with the pots and pans. They're nearly dry by the time you're done washing. Put pots & pans away. Next wash dishes, silverware, cups and glasses. Again, they're nearly dry by the time you're done washing. Drain spout on the rack works well. Cleans easily. I just wipe it down with a sponge, rinse, put it back on the counter; and we're back in business. Folds and stores easily, too. Haven't used the dishwasher since our OXO Good Grips Convertible Foldaway Dish Rack arrived! I highly recommend this kitchen tool!
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Product is grey/stone in color, not white.
customer_reviews.text: This dish rack has all of the features I was looking for, specifically that it could be self-contained without always having to be at an angle draining into the sink, and having feet to lift up from sitting directly on counter tiles. Unfortunately, it looked white in the photos, but it is actually grey/stone in color, so it kind of clashes with my ecru kitchen and tile. I'll live, but I'm a little disappointed. As always, though, OXO built a very good product, and it appears it will outlive my likely outdated tile anyway lol.
customer_reviews.author: sarahkate

customer_reviews.title: Nifty for Smaller Kitchens
customer_reviews.text: Definitely enjoyed this drying rack. We have a smaller kitchen space so I really appreciate the size and the ability to fold it and store it when not in use. This can accumulate grime if not cleaned, dried, and maintained properly (much like you'd see in your shower or tub). Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: David F.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small spaces
customer_reviews.text: I recently moved into an apartment that is very limited on counter space and does not have a dishwasher. I spent a lot of time researching dish racks; I was looking for something with a moveable spout, that was appealing, and could help me maximize my counter space. This was the perfect fit. The white and stainless steel design is clean and keeps the area looking light. The spout just makes it over the lip of my sink and is able to drain all excess water. And additionally, the design is collapsable so I can tuck it under my sink when I have company or if I'm preparing a large meal. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Small but good
customer_reviews.text: I don't own a dishwasher. Phew, glad I got that off my chest (thank you years of therapy). Anyway, it says Stainless steel which is only the metal band handle part. Hard plastic, easy to clean. allows dishes to air dry, and has a small incline to allow water to go into the sink. If you have an undermount sink it would work perfectly. I added a bit of height to get over the lip of my overmount style sink. Over all, does what it should and hasn't caused me any grief.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Burns

customer_reviews.title: Hard to keep clean
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this product, but it does not drain well, even with it raised higher than normal. I tried everything. And because of that, the drainer had slimy residue on it. I cleaned it often to no avail. I would not purchase this product again. Too bad because it really worked well otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Buick

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I did not give this five starts is because this is advertised as being white. However, it’s like a cream color. Otherwise, great!
customer_reviews.author: ilija marčić

customer_reviews.title: a terrific product.
customer_reviews.text: How difficult it is to find a dish rack that doesn't let dishes drip all over countertop! This one fits the bill...AND the extendable tab legs that allow it to tilt toward the sink is a must-have. You'd think this is commonplace on dish racks, but it isn't. The only complaint is the cup and glass pegs are somewhat close together and there's no way to fit more than 2-3 cups across each side. For more than 2 people, this usually means having to put some of the cups in the center section to dry. All in all, a terrific product.
customer_reviews.author: MGW

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for tight counter spaces!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this drying rack for a couple of weeks and I'm very happy with it. it unfolded easily, and I've had to scoot it around a couple of times for cleaning and it has held up just fine. I may update this review after having it for 6 months or a year or so, but so far it is working really well for me!
customer_reviews.author: Belinda

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think I could ever love the look of a dish rack but this thing is pretty cool. I like how it folds up for storage, it has a nice amount of room, and it looks quite nice as well. I don't look at my drying dishes in disgust with how ugly it looks anymore haha. Very nice, happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: admittedly I fill this thing with a lot of stuff
customer_reviews.text: but I've never had a rish rack fail before.. One of the folding arms started popping off after around 6 months and now it will not stay in place at all. I have replaced it for a seemingly more traditional model. I also never used the folding feature so it was not "worn out" from use in that manner. Either way I am disappointed by Oxo... again.
customer_reviews.author: peter w middleton

customer_reviews.title: Good size
customer_reviews.text: Great dish drain rack. Holds alot and drains the water very nicely into the sink. I wish there were option for different drain angles because I would have liked to position it L wise instead of W wise but regardless it's a nice rack and it's nice it can be folded and stored away
customer_reviews.author: Tabzster

customer_reviews.title: Great design!
customer_reviews.text: Love this dish drainer. By it's design it allows the dishes to dry fast, better than any drainer I've used before. The pop up plate holders are great, makes sense to lay them flat for lots of pans or bowls. To keep it clean I simply spray a little cleaner on it, rinse it well as it drains into the sink.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a mostly good design. Lots of room and places to put stuff. Only complaint is that there could be more slots, perhaps as an option, for plates or that the ridges might be a bit taller and less curvy to hold more dinnerware in that area. Also, I found the drain to work well even though there were a few that had issues with it in other reviews. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: binesi

customer_reviews.title: Great design for use
customer_reviews.text: This is the third one I purchased. I had to send the other two back because they did not seem made to fit plates correctly. They were much more expensive too. This is designed so well. Everything fits perfectly. If I want to fold up the plate rack for other items it’s easy. It’s not fancy looking but sits nicely on my counter. It’s a very simple looking piece. I don’t need big and bulky dish racks for my counter. This is very light looking. I’ll just end this by saying I really do like it and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Shar

customer_reviews.title: Mine leaks all over the counter even when I have ...
customer_reviews.text: Mine leaks all over the counter even when I have the drain spout open and the legs down. It is really frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Diane M. Barber

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed
customer_reviews.text: It was hard to find a big enough dish drain in the stores so of course I turned to amazon. This costs a little more than the ones in the store but it’s so much better. It’s really high quality and it has space for a lot of things. It’s going to last a long time
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Leaks water onto the counter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was looking for a sturdy dish rack that I could collapse and put away. It looks nice, has a great design for holding the dishes secure, and folds up easily to be stored. Unfortunately it also leaks. The hinges are not sealed and I end up with a pool of water on my counter under it. I use the feet to tip it toward the sink and the spout to drain into the sink, but I still get a significant amount of water on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: D. Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Light, compact but holds plenty of dishes day by day
customer_reviews.text: This dish rack solved a problem in our kitchen. We have a disposal with a small sink area connected to a larger sink area. The disposal area was too small for washing dishes and if we used the larger sink then food particles washed down the drain. So now we have a three tier system: scrape in the disposal area, rinse or wash in the large area and stack for drying in the dish rack or place in the dishwasher for completing the cleaning process.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Everyone who sees it thinks is super cool and functional
customer_reviews.text: Very cool unique design and never water under drain. Has drainer right into sink. Functionally unique to me going from plain old plastic covered wire dish drain peeling and beginning to rust. Put in dishwasher to clean if needed. Some areas where h20 accumulates can get slimy (small areas where angle not enough to drain). I just wipe down but won’t hurt it if put in dishwasher
customer_reviews.author: cmac

customer_reviews.title: I've never been so excited about a household product!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this! I show it to everyone! I love the way it folds to put away or make more room on the counter! I also love how the inside can fold up or down to make room for bigger items. Plastic is so much easier to clean, and won't rust like the old metal dishrack I had. The only suggestion I would advice is to make smaller holes to drain out and lift it higher on one side to drain. The spout is a nice idea but needs some improvement .
customer_reviews.author: Ava

customer_reviews.title: A great dish rack when you're ready to upgrade from your ...
customer_reviews.text: A great dish rack when you're ready to upgrade from your run-of-the-mill cheap one. It comes neatly packaged, no set-up required, wipes down easily when ready to be put away and handles a lot of dishes like a champ! The only downside is the foldaway sections can stick and prove difficult to fold up for storage. Another winning product from the ever-awesome OXO Good Grips.
customer_reviews.author: J Bechtold

customer_reviews.title: I like to leave my dishes and utensils in the dish ...
customer_reviews.text: Too small for me, and I'm a single man. I like to leave my dishes and utensils in the dish rack, and this one didn't hold enough for me. Also, not that attractive. Now I use a wooden rack for dishes and glasses, and a pad for utensils, which works much better for me.
customer_reviews.author: Politicsmusicandfun

customer_reviews.title: Really great rack
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to wait a bit to write a review. This is the best dry rack. I LOVE it, fits tons of dishes and the middle bit folds down for pots and pans. I love the freestanding ability if needed. It is perfect for 2 people but it may be a bit small for a large family. You could easily put two together. If you want to stash it, it folds up great.
customer_reviews.author: SP BisbeeTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Mixed
customer_reviews.text: Easy set-up. Like the drain spout. Plenty of "spokes" for glasses and cups, but can only us about half of them, because they are too close together. Plate slots also designed to hold only quite flat plates. Those with curved up edges won't go in. Overall, well made, easy to keep clean, but design could use some tweaking.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Impola

customer_reviews.title: Great drying rack
customer_reviews.text: Love this drying rack so much. It comes with different sections to dry everything! Pegs for cups and a rack for dishes, plus ample silverware space and it’s enclosed so our chopsticks don’t fall through! It also has a spout to drain which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: claire

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but I was hoping for a little more.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: I like how large it is and the fact that it won't rust. Small things I'd change: I wish there was a second plate rack row or extra cup rack in the empty flat area that could be folded down like the one rack that's already on there. Also, it doesn't really drain water as well as I thought it would. I have to prop the rack up with some towels for it to be angled enough for the water to drain out. It would have been nice if the legs that fold out were adjustable so you could angle it enough for the water to drain out properly.
customer_reviews.author: swaterssd

customer_reviews.title: Great little rack
customer_reviews.text: I really like this rack. And love that it can fold away. Theres a little design flaw. The drain is too high up. It would be great if it was on the floor of the rack but still had a drain spout, which can be done being the rack is off the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Sightseeing

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! I am in a small studio that has an equally small kitchen and this is perfect. I like it better than the standard ones, it has a spout that u can drain the water when it collects and when the spout is closed, there are no leaks. I like that I can lay the plate holder flat to dry pots and pans. An its really nice having 2 silverware holders. It is also easy to clean the parts to keep scum and mildew away. Best part is I can fold it up and slide it into that far corner that never gets used and keep it out of my way while preparing my meals.
customer_reviews.author: Annaliese

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love this, it’s well made, you can put many dishes in it, it’s easy to fold up and store out of sight. Liked it so much I bought two. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I’d be so excited over a dish rack. It’s the most attractive one I’ve ever seen and I love all the little added functions it has. The drain, the plate stand that can fold flat, the sectioned off cutlery holders, and the large capacity of the whole thing. It’s been great!
customer_reviews.author: Sara buys all the things

customer_reviews.title: Love This!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this drainer because it actually drains the water out. It has a small tilt which helps the water drain and the utensil holders are easy to remove to clean. I like the ability to change the drainer so that you can place a bunch of big items or small items. SO far, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Jenni H

customer_reviews.title: Dish Rack Perfection
customer_reviews.text: This dish rack is dish rack perfection. Seriously. Everything I ever wanted in a drying rack. Drain, clean looking, easy to clean, perfect amount of space for every type of dish.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Boyle

customer_reviews.title: Nice, non rusting drainer
customer_reviews.text: Love that it is so easy to keep clean and that it can’t rust as my last two drainers did. The arrangement of slots for plates doesn’t support them as well as I’d like but the other features make up for that.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Weird drain.
customer_reviews.text: Received today. Although it looks nice it's clear from the design that the water from the dishes won't drain properly. It went back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useful but large drying rack
customer_reviews.text: Pros: it's durable, easy to clean, and has lots of options depending on what dishes you are drying. Cons: it's much, much larger than I anticipated. It takes up a bit too much room on my counter than I would optimally like, but at least you can fold it down and put it away if you need you.
customer_reviews.author: Smitty

customer_reviews.title: So glad I didn't listen to the "naysayers!"
customer_reviews.text: glad I didn't listen to Sothe "naysayers!" Drains well, and my 10 1/2 inch dishes fit nicely in the racks. The poster who said they "leaned" might try just turning the dish around....makes a difference. As a single person, I wash dishes once a day, in the evening, and find the cutlery holder and glass holders do the job. Plenty of room for what I wash. I don't need a dishwasher, hot soapy water is just fine.
customer_reviews.author: arizonareader

customer_reviews.title: Good good
customer_reviews.text: It's made of cheaper material than it's simplyhuman substitutes but it's still very good. I was thinking of getting the simplyhuman product, but I couldn't justify paying so much just for my dishrack to match my appliances. Never looked back. It folds into a small rectangle that I can store under the sink no problem and the little drip tip into the sink is a nice touch. Very nice.
customer_reviews.author: William Sohn

customer_reviews.title: Surprise of the 4.5 ratings -Nice looking but not practical
customer_reviews.text: I like to read the ratings when purchasing; this time, I think they missed this time! Its a looking Dish Rack but not practical. I received the rack last night was excited it matches my kitchen perfectly. This morning, when I when to remove all the dishes I was surprised they were still wet? I thought; it's was odd; however, after I realize its no air circulation like a regular wire dish rack. Therefore the dishes sit there damp. I hope I dosen't get moldy. I 'm going to try to return it.
customer_reviews.author: ANNETTE COLLAZO

customer_reviews.title: Works great as a dishdrainer, but broke when I folded it up to put it away.
customer_reviews.text: Love that this drains so easily and into the sink. Perfect when doing the dishes. Lots of room for items. So disappointed when it broke as I folded it to put it away. As you can see from the photo, little pieces just snapped off.
customer_reviews.author: Fan of Amazon Prime

customer_reviews.title: Best dish drying rack ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely the best hands down dish drying rack ever! Lots of room and very easy to clean as well as space saving, well worth the money. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: huelsmanv

customer_reviews.title: Leaking issue
customer_reviews.text: this tray is beautiful, but leaks at where the spout connects to the tray. its almost as if the spout was put on wrong or not enough material there. i only noticed when there was a big leak over my counter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: actually very cool
customer_reviews.text: and lover easy to open and close and store, do remember you should drain it before close it up, pick it up and dump water all over yourself, not that I did that.......
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Hoke

customer_reviews.title: No water on my counters!!!
customer_reviews.text: Holds pretty many dishes, is versatile using or no using the plate rack and utensil holders for larger dishes, and it's sturdy enough that large glass bowls and pans don't make it lean. Is elevated slightly in the back so it drains well. And my favorite thing, no water on the counter from cups hanging of the edge!! Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great size and mostly great design!
customer_reviews.text: I love this drainer. It holds quite a few dishes, and I've even put a pot or two in there to dry. Only complaint is that I wish the drain was a little longer. I have a drop in style tank with a significant lip/edge, and the drain doesnt quite reach into the sink, instead dripping on the rim. Not the end of the world, but I wish the drain was just 1/2 an inch longer. (I cannot move this cliser to the sink because then the drain sides feet are too elecated and the water just sits in the pan and won't drain.)
customer_reviews.author: Reeser214

customer_reviews.title: really good dish rack
customer_reviews.text: I dunno why people hate on it. There are different designs for all folks. This fits well for everyday use. Accommodation design is well enough that it handles my everyday cleaning. Looks great. I have had a few in my day and this exceeded all expectations. I'll update the review in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best!
customer_reviews.text: I love the way it folds away easily so there is not a drainer on our counters all the time. It has a built in drain board, legs on one end to facilitate drainage plus a drain spout on the other end, fold down rack for plates, silverware and glass holders. It's brilliantly designed and functional.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Radheshwar

customer_reviews.title: Do reccomend
customer_reviews.text: Great product. No dishwasher in my apartment small area to the rugh of the sink this product drains right into the sick lots of different angles to stack and dry dishware. Durable and super easy to clean with no hard to get places that could collect mold.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: This product has plenty of room for multiple items. But, you cant be STUPID and load it down with a family of 4's dinner dishes. Its plastic. It breaks. The quality is excellent, but if you have a large family then just go ahead and order 2. They are definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Got my counter space back!!!! Yipeee
customer_reviews.text: This product works as advertised. I've a had a simple human dish rack for for 8 years. It was time to move in and this is a good replacement. The advantage of this product and getting another simple human rack 1. Price and 2. Foldaway. This allows me to get my counter space back which is something I haven't had in 8 years.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: So easy to clean and maintain
customer_reviews.text: I love that the inserts for holding your spoons, knives and forks is removable, so you can take them out and keep them nice and clean. It has a drip feature that you can drain the water into your sink. Easy to maintain and very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Elba Feliciano

customer_reviews.title: One word...outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Omg this is by far the best fold away dish rack I absolutely love it fitted perfectly on my counter Amazon please keep these in stock I am so impressed with the quality and to think I was an advid shopper at Bed bath and beyond
customer_reviews.author: Cartagena family

customer_reviews.title: Does not drain water...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an old dish drainer that was beginning to rust. The OXO drainer is clearly a sturdy product — but as others mentioned, the spout does not drain water from the rack. Even propping up the end didn't help. So what's the point? And despite the size, the rack holds a limited number of dishes — far fewer than my previous rack. Set up a return and will purchase another dish drainer with an open bottom to place over microfiber drying mat. I'm actually surprised by the overwhelming number of positive reviews...
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: Great design and good materials
customer_reviews.text: We have limited counter space in our small apartment and this dish rack is perfect because it's compact and can foldaway. The design is great and the middle plate-holder (grey piece) can fold down if you're trying to dry something bigger. It's nice to have that flexibility. We've had it for a week and wondered why we didn't get it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Rporter03

customer_reviews.title: this rack looks good however, I notice my dishes don't dry all ...
customer_reviews.text: okay....this rack looks good however, I notice my dishes don't dry all the way. Its because it does not drain the water all the way from the dish rack. I think it should be more steep on one side for the water to completely drain out. I have to use a towel to try my dishes sometimes which sucks because i didn't have this problem with a regular dish rack you can buy from walmart.
customer_reviews.author: Ayman

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: So far it’s a good product. I like the fact that you can fold the dish rack to fit more dishes. It doesn’t drain all the water out BUT I usually clean the extra water left over with a paper towel so it keeps it clean at the same time. It looks small but it’s a perfect size for my counter and it’s very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love modern the design
customer_reviews.text: The design is much nicer than our previous kitchen aid dish rack. It is nice that it is compact and easy to fold up to store. The only downfall so far is that the rack is flat so you have to tilt the rack to drain it throufh the spout.
customer_reviews.author: twinmama

customer_reviews.title: Great little dish rack!
customer_reviews.text: This is working out well while I wait for almost 2 months for my dishwasher part to come in. Love how you can collapse it and store under sink when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Susan P.

product_meta.title: OXO Good Grips Convertible Foldaway Dish Rack, Stainless Steel,,DESIGN 1
product_meta.description: Package Quantity:1| Size:DESIGN 1The OXO good grips foldaway dish rack is convertible, convenient and compact. It features a plate rack that holds plates or bowls neat and upright, and is safe for fine china and delicate dishware. When the plate rack is folded down, it leaves the middle of the dish rack open to accommodate large bowls, cookware, and more. The convenient cup racks hold cups, mugs or wine glasses inside rack to prevent dripping on the counter. Divided utensil holders have a generous capacity and are removable for easy unloading. To drain directly into the sink, simply fold out the feet and snap open the pour spout. The side walls, feet and spout of the foldaway dish rack all fold for compact storage.
feature_bullets: Dimensions closed: 19.4 inches x 12.5 inches x 3.875 inches Pvc not present
Plate rack folds down to make room for large bowls, cookware and more
Legs fold out to elevate Dish Rack and spout opens to drain directly into sink. Open dimensions is 19.4 x 15.5 x 5.125 in inches. Closed dimensions is 19.4 x 12.5 x 3.87 in inches
Tines hold cups, mugs or wine glasses inside Rack to prevent dripping on the counter
Side walls, legs and spout fold for compact, standing storage in cabinet. Utensil cups are removable and dishwasher safe for easy cleaning.Made from BPA free plastic and sleek stainless steel
Divided utensil holders have a generous capacity and are removable for easy unloading. Top Pick by Apartment Therapy
Plate rack holds plates or bowls neat and upright and is safe for fine china and delicate dishware

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,492 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
